All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AddAppointmentController
Presents form which allows user to add new appointments to system.
AddCustomerController
Presents form which allows user to add new customers to system.
Appointment
Class used to create Appointment objects throughout the application.
Contact
Class used to create Contact objects throughout the application.
Country
Class used to create Country objects throughout the application.
Customer
Class used to create Customer objects throughout the application.
DBAppointmentsDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding appointments
DBContactsDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding contacts
DBCountriesDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding countries
DBCustomersDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding customers
DBDivisionsDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding first level divisions
DBUsersDAO
Acts as the connection between the database and any information regarding users
Division
Class used to create Division objects throughout the application.
HelloApplication
 
HelloController
 
helperFunctions
A class of functions used to retrieve ResourceBundles
JDBC
Sets the database connection information to be used by the application
LocalToEST
An Interface used in converting the user's local time to Eastern Standard Time
LocalToUTC
An Interface used in converting the user's local time to UTC
LoginController
Requires user credentials in order to access appointment system
main
Creates an application to schedule and organize appointments.
MainMenuController
Controls user functions for the Main Menu of the application.
ReportController
Controls user functions for the Reports menu of the application.
UpdateAppointmentController
Allows users to update appointments in system
UpdateCustomerController
Presents form which allows user to update customer in the system
User
Class used to create User objects throughout the application.
